text: Pneumosinus dilatans is a condition consisting of abnormal expansion or dilatation of one or more paranasal sinuses. It most often affects the frontal sinus, and can cause damage to vision due to pressure on the nearby optic nerve. The preferred treatment is endoscopic surgery to deflate the sinus. ==Sources== * * ==External links== * MR/CT scans of pneumosinus dilatans from MedPix Category:Diseases of the eye and adnexa Category:Human head and neck Category:Rare diseases Category:Skeletal disorders
title: Pneumosinus dilatans
